poem:
**Corgi on the Corner**

Her shadow slipped past Camden's stones,  
a corgi trotting close behind.  
Director's dreams, celluloid bones,  
now scenes of silence, crime unwinds.  
  
Tape like lines from her films, once bright,  
now seals a script of a different plight.  
In whispers, neighbors talk and bide,  
while corgi waits, tail low, outside.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Woman, 66, held on suspicion of murder after London death of film director A 66-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder after a film director was found dead at home in north London with tape over her mouth. The body of Jennifer Abbott, 69, who was known professionally as Sarah Steinberg, was discovered in her Camden flat on 13 June. She was last seen three days earlier, walking her pet corgi nearby. DI". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Woman, 66, held on suspicion of murder after London death of film director A 66-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder after a film director was found dead at home in north London with tape over her mouth. The body of Jennifer Abbott, 69, who was known professionally as Sarah Steinberg, was discovered in her Camden flat on 13 June. She was last seen three days earlier, walking her pet corgi nearby. DI
